questions.subject: Javascript replace a div's class with another class
questions.question: I have an HTML page with a div and a CSS class attached to it. I want the class element attached to it, to be replaced with another class when pressed a button. And most importantly I don't want a single line of CSS property to be changed of that class, I want the entire class to be replaced by another class.

questions.subject: Flutter: Disable Swipe to Navigate Back in iOS and Android.
questions.question: I'm new to flutter development, and find it a bit frustrating in iOS when you have a navigation drawer and when you swipe to open it, it'll perform a Navigation.of(context).pop(). I would like to disable this "swipe to pop" behavior in iOS. I have been perusing the documentation, but without much luck.

questions.subject: How do you sort a dictionary by value?
questions.question:
I often have to sort a dictionary (consisting of keys & values) by value. For example, I have a hash of words and respective frequencies that I want to order by frequency.

There is a SortedList which is good for a single value (say frequency), that I want to map back to the word.

SortedDictionary orders by key, not value. Some resort to a custom class, but is there a cleaner way?

questions.subject: What is html?
questions.question: Can anyone explain what is html?

questions.subject: PHP Razorpay payment through invoice.
questions.question:
i have integrated Razorpay in php, I'm sending invoice short_url link to customer to view/pay. my question is,
whether there is any option to redirect to my application url once customer made payment through invoice (because i want to save payment related details in table)
is there any option to download invoice pdf in razorpay
or there is any option to stop/restrict payment option via invoice (so that i can send payment link to customer for payments)
Please help!!!

questions.subject: Does this work?
questions.question: Does this work as shown here?

answers.answer: You can add a click event listener to your button if you give it an id, and then change all elements with the class class1 to class2by using aforEach` loop. This way, if you have multiple elements with the class of class1 it will change all of them, not just one of them.Thats it folks!
MaterialPageRoute has a parameter called fullscreenDialog which is set to false by default. When true your page animates a bit differently and swipe to go back on iOS will be disabled.

You could use this one:
var ordered = dict.OrderBy(x => x.Value);

You can sort a Dictionary by value and save it back to itself (so that when you foreach over it the values come out in order):

dict = dict.OrderBy(x => x.Value).ToDictionary(x => x.Key, x => x.Value);
Sorry cant help you with this one :)
I can tell you this works fine my friend.
